alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Lake; Newton; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 03 at 4:57AM EST until March 03 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST TODAY TO 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow, intense snow rates, strong northeast winds, and low visibility. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches expected with locally higher amounts. Due to the nature of the expected narrow snow band, some areas will likely see snowfall less than 4 inches. In addition, northeast winds will frequently gust 35 to 45 mph, though brief gusts to 60 mph are possible this afternoon. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Illinois and northwest Indiana. * WHEN...From noon to 10 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become dangerous with a period of near crippling snowfall and wind for some late this afternoon, including during the Friday afternoon and evening commute. In addition, the combination of heavy, wet snow accumulations on trees and strong northeasterly winds may lead to downed tree limbs and power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour and thundersnow may occur within a narrow but intense band of snow. This will cripple travel conditions including during the afternoon and evening commute, making travel nearly impossible for a time.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Illinois, the latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Indiana, the latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1-800-261-7623.
